item.title: Increase the coverage area of Linksys routers by adding new high-gain antennas
item.description: This is the WRT router four-pack. Linksys, a leading provider of home and business networking solutions and the first company to sell 100 million routers worldwide, has introduced the first dual-band, omni-directional high-gain antennas designed specifically for consumers. These new high-gain antennas from Linksys are sold in two- and four-packs. They enhance Wi-Fi performance by boosting signal strength and throughput, particularly at the edge of a Wi-Fi network. These antennas are compatible with any wireless router equipped with an RP-SMA connection.

item.title: Singtel increases maximum speeds for home office fibre broadband
item.description: Singtel will launch a 10Gbps fiber broadband service for residential customers in Singapore this month. This groundbreaking service, leveraging Singtel’s Next Generation 10GPON (Gigabit Passive Optical Network) technology, follows a successful pilot phase last year. “We promised to provide our customers with the best network innovations and cutting-edge technologies for work and leisure,” said Goh Seow Eng, Managing Director of Home Consumer Singapore at Singtel. “We recognize that residential customers are consuming more bandwidth and need faster speeds for their online activities.

item.title: The UAE has a concentrated ultra high net worth population in Abu Dhabi and Dubai
item.description: The UAE is home to 1,275 ultra wealthy individuals, comprising 20% of the ultra wealthy population in the Middle East, according to Wealth-X. These individuals hold a combined wealth of US$255 billion. The study also found that 57% of the UAE’s ultra high net worth (UHNW*) population built their wealth through entrepreneurship. Inheritance was a less significant factor, with only 8% inheriting their entire fortune and 35% partially inheriting and subsequently growing their wealth.
